revised_title: Investigating the Residual Glow of Radiant Matter through Spectroscopy
tldr: The author develops a phosphoroscope to study the residual glow of phosphorescent materials, such as yttria, after the excitation source is removed. The instrument allows for the observation of phosphorescence in low-pressure environments and reveals differences in the duration and color of the residual glow among various yttrium components.
